intro: Sobralia fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed sobralia, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant features thick, fleshy stems and broad, strap-like leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Sobralia fimbriata thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing on trees or rock surfaces. Its unique floral structure and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and orchid enthusiasts.
